answers.answer: Hi there,The exact cause of your problem can be determined only after a thorough inspection and examination. After the tube is placed you need to maintain cleanliness and hygiene. It is possible that there is some infection which is settling in the J tube. Fungal colonization of J tubes is common and in that case you need to see your doctor. You may need tube replacement. Do keep me posted on how you are doing.Best wishes and regards!

question: hey Docs !  I am a 33 yr old female with  type 1 diabetes.. i have gastropariesis and had a J Tube inserted 7 weeks ago.. about 5 days ago i noticed white spots on the inside of my tube (it is the clear balloon type tube) while I was flushing before a feeding. As the week has progressed the white spots are increasing and now it looks like yeast buildup.  I just tried flushing with diet coke but that didn't do much.  Any suggestions ?  here is a photo [IMG]http://i46.tinypic.com/2s7i1p2.png[/IMG]BTW - Doctors (male and female) are the sexiest of all the professions :)
title: White spotty buildup on inside of my J Tube
